intro: Liabum rusbyi, commonly known as the slender liabum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Liabum rusbyi thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral environments.
